ai.gotit.giap

Class GIAP

  • java.lang.Object
    • ai.gotit.giap.GIAP

  • public class GIAP
extends java.lang.Object
    Main class of GIAP Android SDK.

    Call initialize(String, String, Activity) first to initialize GIAP and its sub-services.

    Then call getInstance() to get singleton instance. CAUTION: getInstance can return null if initialize(String, String, Activity) is not called first.

    Call track(String, JSONObject) to emit your event to the system:

     
 final GIAP giap = GIAP.initialize(
     "http://server-url.example",
     "your_project_token",
     MainActivity.this
 );

 try {
     JSONObject props = new JSONObject();
     props.put("price", 100);
     props.put("package_sku", "package_1_free");
     giap.track("Purchase", props);
 } catch (JSONException e) {}

      Method to map user's id in your system (given by sign-up action, etc.) with current distinctId (auto-generated by GIAP for each user).

      Method to map user's id in your system (given by log in action, etc.) with current distinctId (auto-generated by GIAP for each user), to prevent missing events when user log in on different devices.

      • GIAP

    • Method Detail

      • alias

        public void alias(java.lang.String userId)
        Method to map user's id in your system (given by sign-up action, etc.) with current distinctId (auto-generated by GIAP for each user). Should be called after user take sign-up action.
        Parameters:
        userId - Unique user's id in the product (provided by sign-up action)

      • getInstance

        public static GIAP getInstance()
        Returns:
        Instance of GIAP. Should be called after GIAP.initialize()

      • identify

        public void identify(java.lang.String userId)
        Method to map user's id in your system (given by log in action, etc.) with current distinctId (auto-generated by GIAP for each user), to prevent missing events when user log in on different devices. Should be called after user take log in action.
        Parameters:
        userId - Unique user's id in the product (provided by log in action)

      • initialize

        public static GIAP initialize(java.lang.String serverUrl,
                              java.lang.String token,
                              android.app.Activity context)
        Method to initialize single instance of GIAP and all its sub-services. Should always be call first before interacting with GIAP.
        Parameters:
        serverUrl - URL of GIAP Platform Core API
        token - Token of your product
        context - Application's context that you want to track
        Returns:
        Instance of GIAP

      • registerGIAPActivityLifecycleCallbacks

        private void registerGIAPActivityLifecycleCallbacks(android.app.Activity context)

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Method to generate new distinctId for new user/visitor after current user take log out action. Should always be called after user take log out action.

      • track

        public void track(java.lang.String eventName)
        Method to emit your event, without any custom properties.
        Parameters:
        eventName - Name of the event you want to track

      • track

        public void track(java.lang.String eventName,
                  org.json.JSONObject customProps)
        Method to emit your event, with custom properties. Property's key should be a valid ElasticSearch field name, and should not be started with "$" character.
        Parameters:
        eventName - Name of the event you want to track
        customProps - Custom props as key-value (valid JSON object)

      • updateProfile

        public void updateProfile(org.json.JSONObject props)
        Method to update custom properties of user's profile in GIAP system. Example: email, economy_group, age, ...
        Parameters:
        props - Custom props as key-value (valid JSON object)
